programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2013/14 season. Manchester City clinched their second Premier League title, Jose Mourinho returned to Chelsea and Tony Pulis masterminded a great escape at Palace.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2014/15 season. Eden Hazard's superb form helped Chelsea clinch their fifth title and newly-promoted Burnley and QPR made immediate returns to the Championship.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2015/16 season. Leicester City shocked the footballing world, Jose Mourinho's second tenure at Chelsea came to an end and Newcastle dropped into the second tier.

programme.title: Classic Premier League

programme.title: The Ashes Live
programme.desc: Australia v England. Coverage of day one of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Melbourne Cricket Ground. A Boxing Day Test at this venue is a long-standing annual tradition, and the Aussies have won the last four of those contests, the first of which was a comfortable triumph over England by an innings and 14 runs in 2021, before triumphs over South Africa, Pakistan and India.

programme.title: The Ashes Live
programme.desc: Australia v England. Coverage of day two of the Fourth Test in the five-match series, held at Melbourne Cricket Ground. England have not won a Test here since 2010, when Jonathan Trott's total of 168 helped them to a comfortable victory by an innings and 157 runs. programme.title: After The Roar
programme.desc: Former Leinster, Ireland and Lions rugby captain Brian O'Driscoll goes on a discovery to better understand the mental health struggles elite sportsmen face following retirement.

programme.title: Super Villans
programme.desc: Actor and famous Aston Villa fan Mark Williams narrates the story of how the Villans became Football League and then European champions in 1981 and 1982.

programme.title: Too Good to Go Down
programme.desc: Exploring the difficulty of the post-Sir Matt Busby era at Manchester United and why hitting rock bottom was the only way for a new United to come of age.

programme.title: Pound Land
programme.desc: A look at the trials and tribulations of Ken Bates and Matthew Harding - Chelsea's trailblazing forces of the 1980s and 1990s.

programme.title: The Boot Room Boys
programme.desc: A look at how Liverpool's unique club culture underpinned the club's success. Featuring contributions from Jurgen Klopp, Ian Rush, Phil Thompson and many more.

programme.title: Rocky & Wrighty: From Brockley to the Big Time
programme.desc: The story of how a young David Rocastle's meteoric rise to stardom inspired another legend in the shape of Ian Wright.

programme.title: Playing for Our Future
programme.desc: Asking what the future holds for sport in the battle against global warming. Reshmin Chowdhury meets people at all levels to discuss how sport can be a positive force for change.

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: A look at the Five Nations rugby clash between Scotland and England in 1990, a match which saw both sides going for a potential Grand Slam.

programme.title: Unbreakable: England 2003
programme.desc: A celebratory look back at England's Rugby World Cup-winning team of 2003, as well as some of the difficulties the players have experienced as a result.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at different levels of Speedway to explore the pain and the price of success in one of the toughest and dirtiest sports around.

programme.title: August 4th: An Olympic Odyssey

programme.desc: TV personality Rylan examines homosexuality within football. He takes a look at his own personal experiences and interviews numerous figures from the beautiful game.
